description: This course explores topics in the history of Africa, Asia, or Latin America, designed to emphasize active skills of critical reading, textual and contextual analysis, historiographical argument, and historical writing. Recent topics have included "American Empire: A Cultural History of US-Latin America Relations" and "Imperialism and Nationalism in Southeast Asia." Primarily for history majors; others by permission of instructor. Offered periodically. Also counts toward management studies concentration.
name: Sem: Global & Transnational History
title: Methods Seminar: Histories of Africa, Asia, and Latin America
